SKCxVruKrB9Z4-E8vIRIXQ.text: They are the nicest people here!! I've never eaten in the restaurant, but when you call to place a take out or, they are always so friendly! The food is delicious as always ready quick. It's one of our go to staples.

VwGVRFjYtVs0nQV3Mcn6yw.text: This place presents yummy desserts , taro puff is my favorite, black sticky rice as well. BBQ pork on rice or noodle are also bomb . They do serve real sticky rice, which cooked correctly way. That why i said "real". You can do it with grilled pork, it's yum .

photos.caption: Photo of Curry on Murray - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tender Chicken Satay  Yum  !!!!!

BNG_hm0gX1Y1GASSmJqOZg.text: Food was delicious. The day we were there, service was extremely slow buy it was Good Friday and maybe they were short staffed. Otherwise, it was a nice experience and I would love to return there.

hA1DY6_S4ocASV2kWsaAoA.text: Still on the quest to try all Thai establishments in the Burg we landed in Squirrel Hill this past Saturday to give Curry on Murray a shot.  Street parking is relatively easy to find, at least in the late afternoon early evening hours.  The restaurant is spacious and probably could fit 30-40 people.  When we arrived there were just two other patrons dining, who appeared to be done.  Our server brought two glasses of water stat and handed us menus.  Good start.  We ordered quickly, I went with my usual Pad Kee Mao, spice level 5 (the hottest, or extra spicy as they called it), and we split an order of Tofu fresh rolls.  I asked for Thai Chili paste with the rolls and chopsticks.  After taking our order we waited.  It was actually a rather long wait considering we were the only people in the place waiting on food.  I used the restrooms while waiting and my feet were sticking to the floor as I walked through the place and in the restrooms.  I think it could have used a deep scrub.    Finally our rolls were served and I thought they were a bit on the, well puny side.  There were two, cut in half but really one half was taken care of in one bit. I enjoyed them nevertheless, but when our server delivered them she rushed to drop them off then left.  No Thai chili paste or chopsticks.  I had to get up and hunt her down for my additional requests.  I think it may have been a language barrier but I thought at least the chopsticks would have been a given.  She brought us some chili paste that sat in a very, very sticky carousel with a bowl of sugar??  Guess this came direct from the kitchen that is used to create the dishes?  I have to say I never ever saw that before, and I hope I never do again.  The paste added the spice level needed for the rolls.  Our entrees were served shortly after the rolls, actually before we were even done with them.  Timing wasn't our friend this day.  I have to say, reading about traditional Thai cuisines and making them, to the best of my ability, at home, I notice a lot of places take great liberties with their ingredients.  For instance my husband's Pad See Ew had baby corn in it.  My Kee Mao had al dente green peppers and cherry tomatoes???  Ok I have seen the peppers before but the cherry tomatoes were a first, and I can't say it added anything to my dish and was unnecessary.  All this was somewhat minor in the overall saltiness of both our dishes.  We sucked down the water with three or four refills.  Also my dish was not spicy.  I had to add chili paste to bring up the heat.  This is fine but if I order the spiciest level you offer I kind of expect a kick.  Lastly the noodles were a tad overcooked and mangled, but the tofu was actually really good and there was a lot of it, so bonus on the protein.    Overall I'm glad we tried it so now we know what we aren't missing anymore.  Not a terrible experience, just not worth a repeat.

photos.caption: Photo of Curry on Murray - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. A1. Fresh Roll
Photo of Curry on Murray - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. N3. Pad Kee-Mao with Tofu

W0z466GKUTFSkdXxEqopCA.text: The dumplings and pineapple curry are two of the things I find myself ordering on each visit. I always say I'll order something else and once in awhile I do. The problem is that I like their dumplings and pineapple curry so much that it's all I can think about when someone says, "Curry on Murray". My brain immediately goes to what it already loves.  This was one of my fave places to eat-in and takeaway when living in Regent Square.   If you love Thai as much as I do then you're going to like it here.   Thai it, you'll like it!

kyi1g_ehAos2Tr4NjbUS9A.text: Wow what lovely place to dine in for lunch! My meal was super yummy and came out quickly.   Walking into this establishment, I felt welcomed with a nice smile and a sense of culture. I love when restaurants transform your experience and make it feel like you ventured out of the country.   For my appetizer, I had dumplings which were deep fried. I was hoping for pan fried dumplings but they still were delicious, nonetheless. For my main course, I had chicken  curry which was yellow. I loved that they actually put a lot of meat and veggies in the curry broth. I paid this with white rice and enjoyed my meal.   This was a great place to meet for a lunch or dinner date.

ojV5t7IQCqDG0OmOTQUPcQ.text: Solid thai restaurant! Portions were great and the food tasted great! We had vegetable spring rolls to start which were small in size but fresh. I got the tofu green curry. I thought it looked a little watery but it didnt impact the taste. There were a good amount of veggies. My boyfriend had the extra spicy pork pad thai which was super tasty and fresh, with plenty of meat. I'd come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Curry on Murray - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pad thai
Photo of Curry on Murray - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Green curry

YKDOVVN5xEFeIZd7G1vibA.text: I came here for dinner on Saturday night. At 6:30pm it was suspiciously empty. Nevertheless the food was quite good! I had the pumpkin curry, my friends had the pad Thai and the panang curry. I think the pumpkin was the best. They music they played here was Top 40 from about 5 years ago, which was a little odd. To quote my roommate "they have better song choice than Tequila Cowboy"  This staff here is all very friendly, but they seem quite young. It took a really long time for our check to come (and the restaurant was pretty empty). It would have been 3 stars because of this, but when they brought the check, they also brought us a MOUNTAIN of pineapple candy, yum!  Overall, decent spot.  I wouldn't come out of my way to go here, but if you're in the area it's a good option

photos.caption: Photo of Curry on Murray - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pumpkin curry, delicious!
Photo of Curry on Murray - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pad Thai, good not great
Photo of Curry on Murray - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pineapple candy after the meal!

OKB0hJ2WeMrvRTBors1PNA.text: I've gotta go with 4 stars for Curry on Murray.    Tonight, my girlfriend got the Panang Curry on Rice and I got the Pineapple Curry on rice (both with chicken) and we split the Crab Rangoon.  It was an excellent meal all around; we loved all the food and are super excited about our leftovers for lunch tomorrow.    I only go with 4 out of 5 stars because it seemed like they were a little understaffed tonight and the service was a smidge too slow.  That and it's honestly just really hard for me to go a full 5 out of 5.   Curry on Murray gets a strong recommendation from me (and the girlfriend) for sure.  We'll both be back to get more tasty food!

bGwfsEKaUARNvGucfGeSsA.text: The foods here are great. We had a Kra-Poa, Green Curry, and the  Lemongrass soup. The Lemongrass soup is good, not too sour, but not tasteless. The Green Curry is creamy and it came with a great amount of veggies!  The Kra-Poa has a lot of veggies too! But I like the green curry more than the Kar-Poa and feel like a bowl of ice rice wasn't enough!  The time we went was on Sunday 1pm-ish, the restaurant was fairly slow so we had our food ready pretty quick.

photos.caption: Photo of Curry on Murray - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lemongrass soup
Photo of Curry on Murray - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Green curry with chicken. Recommended!
Photo of Curry on Murray - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kra-poa

ybGTY6rslMW6SIVZPKvGYg.text: On my expedition to find the best pad thai in SqHill my stop today was at Curry on Murray.   I have actually eaten here twice before. One of the best things about this place is the seating in the summer. They open up the large windows to the street so it's almost like sidewalk seating.   Back to the take out pad thai though. I would give this dish three stars. The overall dish was decent but the chicken was over cooked in my opinion. This left the noodles and Thai flavors doing all the heavy lifting. Despite that it was a decent pad thai. Not the best, but certainly not the worst either.   I can say that the other two times I've been here that the food was good as well. Nothing to write home about, but good.   The service has always been extremely friendly and courteous however. So for a summer spot with good service I would say it's worth it!

rFKOpwLoOuoSgOXOctQ3Iw.text: We usually get some decent food from Curry on Murray, but recently the quality has declined drastically. My latest purchase of Pad Thai is inedible. Just wasted my money

CZtx7n_Vbw6hH_JCcp3aJQ.text: Curry on Murray indeed makes one of the best curries on Murray, and within Pittsburgh. The menu is not expansive, having some standard Asian style appetizers, noodle dishes, and a few chef specials. It's a quaint little restaurant with a mom and pops feel, modestly decorated. All of the staff have been incredibly kind and appreciative of your presence.    My green curry had an ample amount of fresh and crispy vegetables. The chicken was cooked nicely, tender and not stringy. The spice mix is excellent. A 4 of 5 was hot enough to be enjoyed by a pepperhead and balanced enough that heat was not the only flavor in the dish.   I think the atmosphere being so humble and the food being so exceptional is what continues to bring me back to this place.  Without pretense they deliver amazing food.

76BzXtuiLlDsWU8fz9A8RQ.text: Just okay. Pretty run of the mill. For Thai food, I rather go to Thai noodle outlet in squirrel hill, or Nicky's Thai food downtown.

photos.caption: Photo of Curry on Murray - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. One take out order of chicken pad see ew and pumpkin curry with rice. $23.52

RGbt6S5fvyOeipwTaEllKA.text: I've been here a couple times and the curry is pretty consistent and good! I've tried the green curry fried rice, pad see yew, and pumpkin curry. Their curry is definitely the best of their menu. The pumpkin curry is a definite go to on their menu! The first few times I came here I got the green curry fried rice but the most recent time I came, it tasted less curry-like. Most of their curries are pretty sweet but not too overpowering spice/sweetness-wise.  The service here is a hit or miss. For the first few times it was decent but the most recent time I came it wasn't so good. We were the only customers in the restaurant but the waiter (seems like he was new) was shaky on taking our order, messed up one of our orders, and it felt like he was kicking us out before we finished our meal.   tldr; food 3.5/5 service 3/5

photos.caption: Photo of Curry on Murray - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

gjeT4SJ3cSrO8a0-L8L2UA.text: Pittsburghers, blessed with dozens of delicious Thai choices, might find it difficult to weed through the best eats. Curry on Murray--new to me but certainly a staple in both the Squirrel Hill neighborhood and the overall Thai food scene--does not disappoint. I've tried my two favorite dishes (pad see ew and pumpkin curry) during my visits. I judge Thai restaurants by these two dishes, to see how the restaurant handles spice levels, noodle preparation and overall quality of ingredients. Their spice scale is accurate and perfectly fiery (if that's what you're in the mood for). Produce is always fresh and crisp. Noodles have both bite and give. My only critique of the food is that they seem to be using a cheaper grade of rice, with lots of broken grains. Parking may be difficult for those not used to street parking.  But, these are minor issues, in no way reflective of my star rating.

photos.caption: Photo of Curry on Murray - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pumpkin curry with tofu; Mr. B. Bending Rodriguez.

QERWK9OajF9EHoYShRIb3w.text: If you want good Thai food this is not the first place I'd choose to go. From the 40 minute wait for our burnt appetizer to the taste in the meal it was not worth the wait. This isn't my first time eating Thai food either, this just was not good. Leaving unsatisfied and looking for another place to eat.

OqLMUk9PvNbrUC6aEmDDpw.text: Absolutely delicious!  I had the Pad Thai with chicken.   My daughter had Yellow Curry with Pork.  Both dishes were extremely flavorful.  One of the best Thai places so far.    The staff was also very pleasant and attentive.  A+

fQ9s9wjTXuC6OGxnNNAqhg.text: Went around 6pm on a Sunday. The service was good and the food was exceptional. I got to try the yellow curry with no spice and panang curry with normal spice levels. Both were great but I think the normal spice really brought the panang to a higher level than the yellow.   I would definitely go back if I was ever in the mood for more curry.

photos.caption: Photo of Curry on Murray - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yellow
Photo of Curry on Murray - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Panang

3iGjdxqXOYwN4MUaJzrfqw.text: This is absolutely my favorite Thai place in the area, unfortunately the service has gone extremely down hill since they hired their latest employee. I don't know her name, but you know her because she can be defined as incompetent. The food is fantastic and until recently I have not had any issues here. I called to place a pickup order, and the lady was actively arguing with a customer, while on the phone with me. She asked me to repeat my order three times because she was too busy arguing with that other customer. I showed up 15 mins after the call, which is when I was told the food would be ready. I went to the register to try and pay and was told that I needed to be seated. I clarified that I was picking up, and was told again to be seated. I waited in the chair by the register for another 20 mins. Finally I go up again and ask to pay, she acts as if shes never seen me before, and says my food isnt ready before even asking my name or my order. I told her anyway and she turns around and looks at the shelf where my food is sitting (and has been for the past 8 minutes) and says "oh here it is." It seemed another customer was having an issue the same time as me as well.   TLDR: Fantastic food. normally excellent service, something needs to be done about the abysmal service of the new staff lady as she is completely incompetent and extremely rude.

XNxQ4f8pd4JejLoF7nop_w.text: Very friendly staff! Food was good, but not out of this world. A solid Thai restaurant.  Accidentally rolled in to Curry on Murray at 2:45 (they close at 3pm before dinner). The hostess was extremely friendly and said it would be no problem to order something to-go. Got the pad thai vegan style (no egg or fish sauce, with tofu) medium heat. Honestly was still very mild in flavor, but it helped to have the nuts (walnuts possibly?) in the dish to bring on a nutty, not overpoweringly sweet flavor. Generous portion of tofu as well, and solid portion size.  Wouldn't go out of my way for this place, but a solid choice along Murray. Thanks!

photos.caption: Photo of Curry on Murray - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pad Thai to go, around $11.50 at lunch

elUlwcWcxQkLXfvzUSxHYg.text: Curry on Murray has excellent food, quick service, and a hard working, attentive, and kind staff. They even package your leftovers for you and give a very gracious "thank you." This was my first experience with Thai curry, but I can't wait to try it again.

4wB5OERJdW6gEpVn33p59g.text: I got delivery from curry on Murray for the first time tonight. While the green curry fried rice is delicious, the massaman curry confused me to no end. It was literally a container with sauce and an uncut potato in it. One potato. Clearly not cooked in the sauce but boiled and plunked in a container with sauce. No vegetables or peanuts, just a potato. While the sauce is nice, this presentation is really unappealing and makes me too aware that I was just charged 12 dollars for one potato. Will stick to rice or noodle dishes from now on.

56JrUbp_tvdAwCvLt4mggw.text: Thin coconut / tom kha soup. Chicken pad thai was good but i had to add more hot pepper flakes after i requested it be very spicy. Overall, mid-grade Thai food.

HAda8Ra_jHFhAhYBWlbvIA.text: Neat and clean decor with a nice window view onto Murray Avenue at Curry on Murray.  The Pad Thai I ordered was quite good with plenty of fresh veges and just the right amount of heat as I had requested.  Not the absolute best I've ever had, but I would eat here again.

qyXqhpIcBvFlrhWJeUWAow.text: I finally tried the curry and it was excellent, changing my former opinion of Thai curry.  I've eaten here a lot over the past 3 years and been consistently pleased with the food and service.  I will miss it after I move.

evN0Gozv_K-lQ4p-KDl3oA.text: I really wanted to like this place.  It looks really nice inside and the wait staff are warm and friendly.  I ordered a curry chicken dish here recently and it was not the best.  The sauce was really good, but there were no veggies in the meal, and the chicken was tough and dry.   I may try it again to see if I just went on an off night, but I was not impressed with my meal.

KVaD1EGZ2a9z0X-OEiPBag.text: The green curry here is my favorite dish here for which I always request steamed tofu.  The spiciest level is perfect for the dish and the curry has been consistent each time I have tried it.  The prices for lunch are cheap and almost double for dinner although it is still reasonable.  This restaurant is a staple of mine while I'm in squirrel hill, although thai places abound in the area.

vXaV0Vu0WrsT-h49z8TFAA.text: Love the pumpkin curry, mango salad and the mussels on coconut sauce. How can you go wrong ? You can't. Great price, nice service and byob!!!

zTiKYtJcmJJ2sNkUhQ-_eA.text: I really like this place...  A quick visit to the website will describe a lot about this place and the passion/vision of the restaurant and its owners. This is very fresh, very authentic, very delicious Thai food. The restaurant is clearly in its very early opening stages. What is refreshing about the experience is that they are open and transparent about the fact and they will take the time to address the obvious kinks and give you the exact date for their resolution. Their (currently) limited menu is sure to point out that it's a temporary menu being offered only until their Grand Opening which is yet TBD. The ambiance was relaxing yet lively and vivacious. I was there for lunch and groups of people seemed to be enjoying themselves immensely and highly complimentary. I was immediately impressed by the menu; it seems as if someone identified all the best Thai dishes around the city and put them on one menu. I had the shrimp Pad Thai (which i believe should be the starting point and litmus test for any new Thai food experience), the shrimp were perfectly cooked, fresh and incredibly seasoned. The garnishing of incredibly fresh and crunchy bean sprouts along with the light dust of Thai seasoning added excellent texture and depth to the dish. The incredibly fresh green onion slivers added beautiful color and a sharpness that complimented the sweetness and spiciness of the dish perfectly. In all i found both the experience and the food to be fantastic; this notion was only exacerbated by the cordial and personal interaction of the manger (which btw is the tried and True key to long-term success on Murray Ave.) and the resourceful and friendly wait staff.   For those looking for a great new place to try and fantastic, authentic Thai food, Curry on Murray is a must try!

-CsgykZGWhnBz4OCU-QaDA.text: First I'll start off with the good.  The atmosphere is nice, "Thai colors" not overly crowded,  semi-formal but comfortable.  There was one waitress working and one gentleman who I think was working in the kitchen helped outside.  They were both very nice, pleasant, and provided excellent service. The fresh spring rolls with tofu were wonderful, fresh tasting, and came with one of the better dipping sauces that I've had at Thai restaurants. The "Coconut Soup" was very disappointing.  There was no hint of Kafir Lime leaves, or of Galangal.  It tasted like chicken stock with light coconut broth and chilies, nothing else.  This is one of my favorite starters and I was taken aback by it. The Pad Thai was pretty good, although didn't come served with a lime wedge.  I asked for one, but was told they don't carry limes. The prices are a few dollars less than many of the other Thai restaurants in the neighborhood.  From working in restaurants for about 10 years, I summarize that they have potential to cook great, tasty food, but perhaps need to increase the prices to buy the ingredients necessary to properly cook the dish. Cutting corners is never a way to be a successful restaurant.  Charge whatever you need to, make the menu items properly, or don't offer them.

xeIKhQR92G3pyQHW5GWhcA.text: Good service, friendly. Got massamum curry both times, good flavor but the chicken was fairly dry (it comes in large chunks so it is possible to tell even though it is in a curry) one if the times I had it. Will go back.

-9mx6oh6FkMeG9tYrPZOCg.text: This is a terrific place. Mind you, we've only had lunch there once, and had shied away a bit because my significant other doesn't readily warm up to Thai food. It is very nicely appointed, clean, nice colors, photos on the wall, pleasant and comfortable ambience. The lunch was great, soups wonderful, appetizers to kill for. There is a mix of 3 appetizers that includes the best crab rangoons we've had yet in Pittsburgh, or anywhere else for the matter of that.  Lemon Grass soup with seafood was zingy, tasty, and filled with fish and mussels, shrimp, and scallop. Ditto the wonton soup, not your usual, tasty and packed with good stuff. We both warmed up to his place righrt away. Heading back for dinner in the near future.

g1kFGCRVu5GT2CD1WYncEw.text: Solid place overall. Happy with my experience.  I really enjoy their pad thai - extra spicy.  Always very quick service.  Their take-outs quality is just as good as dine in. Great place to pick up food on my way home from work.

Zy3y3XePe1tXS9zgDJGW1g.text: Delcious! Great service! Get the curry trio.

9rxN31L3Lg0rw5Q22DmMmw.text: Most flavorless fried rice I've ever had.  Admittedly, I didn't choose an exciting thai dish but figured for my first time, I'd get something simple to go.  Bad choice.  No flavor.  Dry.  Was looking in my office for a packet of soy sauce or something to put on it.  Bad enough that I wouldn't risk going there again.

AGtBofqpDTeq14knN_mX-w.text: 1st of all...I had high hopes that this place would be good since I had been to another of their restaurant in Swissvale called "Curry Away".  However..this Squirrel Hill location was the WORST Thai I've had in Squirrel Hill. I was highly disappointed. The food was only Ok, I cook better than that(Sorry, I am from South East Asia)...and the service even worse.  No menus for 10 mins after been seated...the server said she did not even know where the menus located... They seated us next to the door, a  large table & was not comfortable to sit at all---table is too low!!!!! The postcard said free dessert & none was served.  We ordered Massaman curry which is just ok, Pad SEE-EW, & Crispy Chicken with nuts...the last two dishes which were probably two of the worst I've ever had, the portion was so small for $11.00 and white serving dishes is absolutely not very presentable. To me its Americanized Thai foods...not authentic at all. We all was very disappointed.     Overall a very disappointing experience.   :(

0vA4Z4R1D7tXUNfmcL9RvA.text: I had the pumpkin curry, which was good.  As one of the reviews above mentioned there's no grade inflation in the spiciness scale--I asked for my food "spicy" and it was definitely an eight out of ten on my personal scale  The actual reason I'm leaving a review though is that I forgot my phone on the seat after the meal and the server ran three or four blocks to give it back to me, which was SO nice and really above and beyond the call of duty.

Y0S50buMtIvhDqRh6C9JNg.text: This is an ok thai place. The ambiance, decoration, and layout of the restaurant leaves something to be desired, but I think that is because they opened relatively recently; hopefully with more patrons the place will get spruced up. The service was very friendly and attentive, which is always nice. Their food is far from the best in Pittsburgh, in my opinion, but it is certainly decent.

9qrYnL_5z6kJR3yFUJDlXQ.text: Definitely enjoyed the pumpkin curry.  The service was quick and friendly.  Thai in Pittsburgh (along with most non-American style food) generally is a little more expensive for whatever reason.  That being said this was definitely as good as most of the other Thai restaurants in the Pittsburgh area I've been to.  I'd say it's not as good as Nicky's but probably as good as any of the ones in Bloomfield or Sq Hill, but only basing it on one dish really.  The noodles didn't seem like anything out of the ordinary so try and stick with the curry.  Will go back.

_xcdc1UR_BF2DhGMKitcgg.text: went there with 2 friends.  we got DELICIOUS spring rolls, the THIN pad thai (we asked for a 3-4 out of 10, came out very mild), and 2 curries (the base is "medium", which is very hot).  tasty food all around (except for the spice levels); the think pad thai was tasty but clumpy--i'd recommend the regular pad thai.  the staff is GREAT!

XyyqQEOr5Gu5CI5B9-u78w.text: I was finally here earlier in November after wanting to try this little place for awhile.  Our waitress was very attentative and helpful, even bringing out a wine chiller for the bottle that was brought.  The appetizer (some trio of spring rolls, rangoons, something else) was nice, and my entree of pad kee mao was delicious.  Spicy food in restaurants is never spicy enough for my weird taste buds so it was nice when the waitress brought out a tiny bowl of additional spice for the meals.  The prices seem to be usual for similar places around here, and the portion sizes are similar as well, if not slightly smaller (very filling for a meal, just no lunch the next day).  All in all it was a great experience, and I'll be back again!

29avxcmoNPW3gVZdErxbrA.text: Stopped by here for an early dinner and was very pleased. New to Thai food, so asked for recommendations and the waitress was happy to oblige. Very attentive service - our waters were refilled several times throughout the meal. The restaurant wasn't very busy as it was relatively early, but there were about 4 other tables being served at the time. Appetizers and entrees arrived in a timely manner. The sampler tray of rolls we ordered as an appetizer were delicious with delicate wraps. Entrees were equally delicious. Had choice of "spiciness" for each. It was a warm day and we chose to sit next to the open window and had a nice view of passersby and ongoings. Will definitely return on another visit.

yPSrtKbd8HLCGsn8-dqdxg.text: Here I am on a generous day giving Curry on Murray three stars. I am one of those clueless people who thought for the longest time ever that the place has indian style curries. Surprise surprise: they're thai! It seems like the place is family run and that in itself is adorable. The service was great with extra care for making us feel comfortable. The food had a lot to be desired, with sauces that were on the sweet and sour rather than savory style. I'm hoping they progress towards simpler dishes with fewer ingredients that don't get jumbled up into one hot mess of nondescript curry.

3tsKQfOK5UaptcwoIhrQeA.text: The place looks alright but the food is horrible. I ordered this pad Thai and my noodles were hard.. Like seriously. & the guy wondered why I barely ate it then take it home. Shit, it tasted horrible.

llnlSw9uboMgc4p569IV2w.text: The decor & open air dining atmosphere was perfect for a September evening. We were greeted & seated promptly. We started with the tofu fresh rolls which were delicious. We ordered the Chicken Pad Thai & the Pad Kee Mao for our entrees. They came out looking fresh & the temperature was just right. The flavors of the Pad Kee Mao were wonderful.  The Pad Thai was good but lacked the usual robust flavors I've had elsewhere.  It was our 1st time & think it may be our last.

MmfF3QMMhvrOUEGaN5qDaA.text: Highly recommended! Great atmosphere, serving staff was very friendly, and the meal was prepared very promptly. Overall a great experience.

hmgMJ0q_JoXCbq5OsLmntA.text: The owner was kind enough to offer a certificate to fix the rice being left out after finding my review on Yelp. She was very kind about the everything, and I really appreciate her checking reviews.

S_-s4lyY8DO2VO15MvKTyQ.text: I went with a friend for lunch. Cost us $15 each for a lunch special, soup and tip.   Seated and served promptly. We both felt the food was tasty -- I felt the food was very good, he was not as enthusiastic, so I averaged my 5 and what I felt was his 3. My food (coconut soup/tofu and green curry/chicken) were both very nicely seasoned and very flavorful.  Some have mentioned about value for price. In my case, it was about $6 for the soup, $7 for the green curry and $2 tip. I think you can make the case that the soup is way over priced (it was a simple cup, not one of  those gigantic sizzling rice soups you sometimes get in restaurants.)  The only other comment I'd offer is that the spiciness ratings may be set for low American expectations. I ordered spicy and he ordered medium. He commented that he could not detect any spiciness while I had a moderate amount. Certainly nothing that I'd rate as spicy.

dVszW3p7uF6U5ajGcluilw.text: Very delicious food and relaxing atmosphere. You can tell they are not a chain or mass produce their food, it tastes fresh.

4IVCRuD8vJSOMHsRIM_AvA.text: I recently posted a review of Curry on Murray, affording it three stars and praising the food and the service.  I prominently noted in the review, however, that the restaurant is a poor value, and indicated the extraordinary value that is offered at a restaurant like India Garden, with its enormous and top-notch lunch buffet, for which one pays a mere $8.49 per person with website coupon.  My Curry on Murray review elicited the following response, obviously from the owner, who misinterprets my comments:  "You must really hate us to have the exact review copied over to many websites.  I'm sorry.  There are reasons  we don't quite see Thai or French restaurants serving buffet.  Among them are perception of food and difficulties business-wise.  I hope you understand."  I posted the review at this site and another, as I want potential diners to have my thoughts available to them before dining here.  That is the purpose of such sites. How can a three-star review which praises the food and service mean that the reviewer hates the restaurant? Three stars, after all, means "A-OK", per Yelp. I did not indicate that Curry on Murray should offer a buffet.  I merely point out the stark difference between the value that is offered at a restaurant that has a buffet and the $40+ that a modest size meal for two commanded at Curry on Murray.

6WbOxuC9yqcyDOBHhCkYcA.text: I love the food my favorite are the dumplings and the fresh rolls. I also love the crab fried rice. The service is excellent

A4NwjnFK5-TZKknAW9OqMw.text: The only reason I am giving Curry on Murray four stars instead of five is because I got takeout, so I can't judge the service.  However, the food we did get was just excellent.  We tried the crab rangoons, the chicken satay, the chicken massaman curry and a pumpkin curry with shrimp.  All that was very good.  But the chicken larb...oh my god.  I would go back just for that.  And I plan to.

OyDwJa7nRyokoVe3HalCmA.text: This is a cute little Thai restaurant, which surprised me because for some reason I thought it was going to be an Indian restaurant! It's a good thing I like both Thai food and Indian food. The wait staff was friendly, and the restaurant seemed clean and modern. On Friday and Saturday nights they have live music while you eat which was a cello and guitar duo the night we were there. I tried my standard, chicken pad Thai, which was good although not my favorite in town. My dining companion got the green curry with tofu which was one of the better ones I've had in town. All in all, a good experience and which places it in the top three Thai restaurants I've tried in Pittsburgh. Although I've only tried this location once, I will be back.

U8bLXQnhiwpBREDxLgobww.text: I was, at first, skeptical about Squirrel Hill getting yet another Thai restaurant, but Curry on Murray manages to differentiate itself from the other great nearby offerings.  The style of curries is a little different, and the appetizer selection adds an extra dimension.  Everything was well-executed and tasted good.  I found myself particularly impressed by the presentation of the dishes.  Artfully arranged and brightly colored, it was the visuals as much as anything that made me excited to dig in (and perhaps broke the tie between 3 and 4 stars).  A friendly staff, pleasant even when dealing with some very rude customers two tables over, rounded out the experience and made Curry on Murray worth revisiting.

Ij4ZA22fJjuPBe8R1t0IqA.text: Curry on Murray is a brand new restaurant that just had its grand opening on July 12, 2012.  They now take credit cards.  The food is quite good, but when there on July 14 we had to wait for an hour before our food arrived.  When I asked why it had taken so long I was told it was because the kitchen was backed up because they had never had a full house before.  The live music was quite nice and was a relief from the canned crap that most restaurants blast at you these days.  Even when the entertainers wrapped up and left, the canned music at Curry on Murray was pleasant.  I hope that once they have been open for a while the kitchen will be able to prepare food with a much shorter wait.  During our first visit there before the grand opening when there were only a few occupied tables the service was much faster and the food was excellent.  When full the restaurant is a bit noisy because the walls and floors are all hard surface.

h6cSZdB8oKsSR9yPD93pnQ.text: The atmosphere in this restaurant was romantic and peaceful. We went on Thursday night, and there was only one server. She maintained a calm demeanor, though she had a lot of tables, and she was very attentive. The food was delicious, and the portion size was adequate.

EHdY97XMNjPoA0iAjYfpRw.text: We tried curry on murray last week and were sadly disappointed.  The rennovation from sababa did little to improve the space - it is still very sterile with lots of hard smooth surfaces which do little to lower the noise level.  More importantly, the curry's were lacking in flavor.  We had both the green curry with tofu and the pumpkin curry with duck.  Both were disappointing.  We started with the papaya salad which we ordered spicy - and it was - but the only spice content was heat - no flavor.

j50OK6fEh0xgU6NfkXYUAg.text: I'm making my way down the curry menu and I haven't found a bad one yet!!

bGDtis9_MPGIBjtr8JXLpA.text: I find the food here is good.  The curries are all very tasty the pad thai is also good i had the pad sew ew it was not very good very spicy with little taste.  However i would eat the curries again and the service was great plus the have live music on the weekends to make it a very enjoyable fun place to eat.

l1e-mnIdnRHCx6dm7jXYHg.text: The best Thai food in Squirrel Hill, in my opinion! We had fresh rolls with tofu (with delicious peanut sauce for dipping), and I got the Pad See Ew with chicken, which was delicious. I ate almost all of the very generous portion! My friends ordered various curries, which were also great. I tasted the pumpkin curry, which was awesome! I've seen that on a lot of Thai menus, but never tasted it before-- it was great! For dessert we had mango sticky rice, which was just perfect. I am a huge mango fan, and the combination of the perfectly ripe mango with the sweet rice was just.... yummmm. The service was also fantastic! Our waitress was friendly and efficient, and the owners are very friendly as well. You can tell it's a family business, in the best way possible. Currently they are in a pre- grand opening phase, so they are only accepting cash and have a somewhat limited menu. However, we were told that the grand opening will be July 12th, and by then they will have expanded the menu and will take credit cards. Also, with any luck they will have live music on grand opening day, so it should be a really nice event! I know I'll be back then. :)
